a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: Share of population living in extreme poverty, World, 1820 to
Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $1.90 per day. Data after 1981 relates to household
income or expenditure surveys collated by the World Bank; before 1981 it is based on historical reconstructions of GDP per capita
Note: Data is measured in international-$ at 2011 prices to account for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries.
